data.title: Operation Paperclip
data.meta_description: Operation Paperclip - Free ebook download as PDF File (.pdf), Text File (.txt) or read book online for free. This document provides an acknowledgements and prologue section for a book about Operation Paperclip from 1945 to 1990. Operation Paperclip was a secret US program that brought over 1,600 German scientists, including some implicated in Nazi war crimes, to work for the US after World War 2. The prologue reveals that Paperclip lasted much longer than previously reported, until 1973, and remnants remain today. It also discusses how one of the intelligence officers running Paperclip, Lt. Col. William Whalen, was convicted of espionage for selling secrets to the Soviet Union while heading the Joint Intelligence Objectives Agency. The prologue sets up that the book will explore the legacy of inhumane experiments on US soldiers using Nazi science,
